4.text: The sons of Noah: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

5.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

6.text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

7.text: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites.

8.text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

9.text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

10.text: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who began to be a mighty one on the earth.

11.text: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,

12.text: the Pathrusites, the Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites.

13.text: And Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,

14.text: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,

15.text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,

16.text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.

17.text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.

18.text: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.

19.text: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided, and his brother was named Joktan.

20.text: And Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

23.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.

24.text: So from Shem came Arphaxad, Shelah,

28.text: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.

29.text: These are their genealogies: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

31.text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.

32.text: The sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.

33.text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All of these were Keturah’s sons.

34.text: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.

35.text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

36.text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz; and by Timna, Amalek.

37.text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

38.text: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

39.text: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.

40.text: The sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.

41.text: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

42.text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.

43.text: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites: Bela son of Beor. His city was named Dinhabah.

44.text: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place.

45.text: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

46.text: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Avith.

47.text: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.

48.text: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates reigned in his place.

49.text: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place.

50.text: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.

51.text: Then Hadad died. Now the chiefs of Edom were Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

54.text: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
